version: Cisco Cloud Controls Framework (CCF) Public Release V2.0+++
description:
This file is the Cisco Cloud Controls Framework (CCF).

It is a Unified Control Framework mapping matrix. It defines a set of internal master controls (labeled CCF 1, CCF 2, etc.) and maps each one to equivalent requirements in numerous global standards, including ISO 27001, SOC 2, NIST, BSI C5, and EUCS.

It acts as a "translation layer" to help organizations manage compliance with multiple standards simultaneously using a single set of controls.
Associations with external schemes:
SOC TSC Common Criteria
SOC TSC Availability
SOC TSC Confidentiality
SOC TSC Privacy
ISO 27001 ISMS
ISO 27002: 2013 Annex A
Cloud Service Customers ISO 27017
Cloud Service Providers ISO 27017
ISO 27018
PII Controller ISO 27701
PII Processor ISO 27701
ISO 22301
BSI C5
FedRAMP Tailored Control
Spanish ENS BASIC Control
Spanish ENS Medium Control
Spanish ENS High Control
ISMAP Control
PCI Control
Saudi CCC Control
EU Code of Conduct Control
NIST SP 800-171 Control
EUCS Basic Control
EUCS Substantial Control
EUCS High Control
SecNumCloud Control
IRAP Control
Head of file:
$ head ./Cisco.csv

description: Spanish ENS parsed with python script from original pdf. . Check the code inside 'Other/pdfFilesAndParsers/spanishENS/'. This file is a control catalog for the Spanish Esquema Nacional de Seguridad (ENS). It is not a mapping file; it simply lists each control ID (e.g., org.1.1, op.pl.1.1) and provides its official description.
Head of file:
$ head ./SpanishENS.csv
Control ID,Description
org.1.1,The objectives or mission of the organization.
org.1.2,"The legal and regulatory framework within which the activities will take 
place."
org.1.3,"Security roles or functions, defining for each the duties and 
responsibilities of the post, as well as the procedure for their appointment and renewal."
org.1.4,"The structure of the security management and coordination committee(s), 
detailing it's area of responsibility, it's members and the relationship with other elements of 
the organization."
org.1.5,"Guidelines for the structuring of system security documentation, it's

description:
BSI-C5 controls without association, only associated with their own ID. Obtained through admin/admin authentication. This JSON snippet is a control catalog, likely from Germany's BSI C5 framework.
It defines individual security controls (like OPS-16, IAM-03, and the AI-specific SR-06) and assigns them to their respective categories. This file is a definition list, not a mapping file, as the fields for external associations (sourceSimilarControls) are all null.
Head of file:
$ head -50 ./BSI-C5.json

description: French SecNumCloud parsed with python script from original pdf. Translated with google translator APIs. Chck the code inside 'Other/pdfFilesAndParsers/secNumCloud/secnumcloud-referentiel-exigences-v3.2.ipynb'. This file is a control catalog for France's SecNumCloud standard. It lists each control ID (e.g., 5.1.a) alongside its official French description and an English translation.
Head of file:
$ head ./Secnumcloud.csv
ID,Description,Description_EN
5.1.a,Le prestataire doit opérer la prestation à l'état de l'art pour le type d'activité retenu : utiliser des logiciels stables bénéficiant d'un suivi des correctifs de sécurité et paramétrés de façon à obtenir un niveau de sécurité optimal.,The service provider must operate in the state of the art for the type of activity selected: Use stable software benefiting from monitoring of safety and configuration fixes so as to obtain an optimal security level.
5.1.b,"Le prestataire doit appliquer le guide d'hygiène informatique de l'ANSSI [HYGIENE], niveau renforcé, au système d'information du service.","The service provider must apply the ANSSI computer hygiene guide [Hygiene], reinforced level, to the service information system."
5.2.a,Le prestataire doit documenter et mettre en œuvre une politique de sécurité de l'information relative au service.,The service provider must document and implement an information security policy relating to the service.
5.2.b,La politique de sécurité de l'information doit identifier les engagements du prestataire quant au respect de la législation et réglementation nationale en vigueur selon la nature des informations qui pourraient être confiées par le commanditaire au prestataire ,The information security policy must identify the service provider's commitments regarding compliance with the national legislation and regulations in force according to the nature of the information which could be entrusted by the sponsor to the service provider.
5.2.c,La politique de sécurité de l'information doit notamment couvrir les thèmes abordés aux chapitres 6 à 19 du présent référentiel.,The information security policy must in particular cover the themes addressed to chapters 6 to 19 of this repository.
5.2.d,La direction du prestataire doit approuver formellement la politique de sécurité de l'information.,The service provider must formally approve the information security policy.
5.2.e,Le prestataire doit réviser annuellement la politique de sécurité de l'information et à chaque changement majeur pouvant avoir un impact sur le service.,The service provider must revise the information security policy annually and with each major change that may have an impact on the service.
5.3.a,Le prestataire doit documenter une appréciation des risques couvrant l'ensemble du périmètre du service.,The service provider must document an assessment of the risks covering the entire perimeter of the service.
5.3.b,Le prestataire doit réaliser son appréciation de risques en utilisant une méthode documentée garantissant la reproductibilité et comparabilité de la démarche.,The service provider must carry out its risk assessment using a documented method guaranteeing the reproducibility and comparability of the process.

description: Data from Medina repo. This file is a Metrics Catalog. It defines a list of specific assessment rules, questions, and checks (metrics) used to verify the compliance of cloud services. Each metric describes what needs to be measured or monitored (e.g., "assess if backups are enabled") to satisfy a specific security requirement.
Head of file:
$ head ./medinaMetrics.csv
ID,controlId,description
1,OPS-05.3H,This metric is used to assess if the antimalware solution is enabled on the respective resource.
2,OPS-05.3H,This metric is used to assess if the antimalware solution reports no irregularities.
3,OPS-07.2H,This metric is used to assess if backups are enabled for a cloud service/asset
3,OPS-09.2H,This metric is used to assess if backups are enabled for a cloud service/asset
4,OPS-07.2H,This metric is used to assess the configured backup retention (days) on a cloud service/asset
5,OPS-13.1H,This metric is used to assess if Anomaly Detection is enabled for the cloud service/asset
6,OPS-13.1H,This metric is used to assess if activity logs are enabled for the cloud service/asset.
7,OPS-13.1H,This metric is used to assess if Application logs are enabled for the cloud service/asset.
8,OPS-13.1H,This metric is used to assess if Boot logs are enabled for the cloud service/asset.
(.venv) john@john-ThinkPad-E485:~/Repositories/ControlsMetrics/Schemes$

description: Data from excel file on the fabsasoft repository (excel file). This file is an Automated Security Metrics Catalog. It defines specific technical checks (metrics) designed for automated compliance tools (like Codyze and Clouditor-Discovery). Each entry details the technical criteria, the logic for passing the check (e.g., Operator: ==, Target Expression: true), and links these technical checks to high-level security requirements.
Head of file:
$ head ./fabasoftMetrics.csv
Category,ID,Name,Description,"""Selector"" (concepts and properties)
(Add path from the SecurityFeature, if no SecurityFeature is linked use the path from the resource)",Scale,Datatype,Range,Operator,Target Expression,Evidence From tool,"Possible Control ID
Scheme"

description: Last version of controls mapped sended by Iñaki via mail. This file is a control mapping matrix. It maps metrics to EUCS (European Union Cybersecurity Scheme) to their equivalent controls in other standards, specifically Germany's BSI C5, France's SecNumCloud, ISO 27002, and ISO 27017. The new associations focus on linking EUCS controls to updated schemes (SecNumCloud, ISO 27002, ISO 27017), whereas the old version linked EUCS only to BSIC5. This version is not a superset of 'OldEucsRequirements.csv'. In addition to containing more controls, the text of some existing controls has been updated. In this version we added text from original eucs pdf file thorugh automatic parsing a manual reviewing.
Associations with external schemes:
BSI C5: OIS-04
SecNumCloud: 6.1 e 6.2
ISO 27002: 5.3
ISO 27017: CLD.6.3.1
Head of file:
$ head ./NewEucsRequirements_with_texts.csv
EUCS Category,EUCS Control (2022),Control_Code,EUCS Ref (Detailed),EUCS Text,EUCS Ass. Level,Code,C5.2020 GERMANY ,SecNumCloud FRANCE ,ISO 27002 ,ISO 27017

5.21",
A1 - Organisation of Information Security,OIS-01  - INFORMATION SECURITY MANAGEMENT SYSTEM,OIS-01,OIS-01.2,The ISMS shall be in accordance to ISO/IEC 27001,Substantial,,OIS-01,,"5.4
5.21",
A1 - Organisation of Information Security,OIS-01  - INFORMATION SECURITY MANAGEMENT SYSTEM,OIS-01,OIS-01.3,The ISMS shall have a valid certification according to ISO/IEC 27001 or to national schemes based on ISO 27001,High,,OIS-01,,"5.4
5.21",
A1 - Organisation of Information Security,OIS-01  - INFORMATION SECURITY MANAGEMENT SYSTEM,OIS-01,OIS-01.5,"The documentation shall include at least:  Scope of the ISMS (Section 4.3 of ISO/IEC 27001);  Declaration of applicability (Section 6.1.3), and  Results of the last management review (Section 9.3).",Substantial,,OIS-01,,"5.4
5.21",

description: Data from Medina repo (Eucs). This file is a Control Catalog (specifically a Requirements Catalog). It serves as a "dictionary" that defines the official requirements for specific security controls. It lists the unique Control ID (e.g., OPS-05.3H) and provides the full textual description of what the Cloud Service Provider (CSP) must implement to comply.This version is not a subset of 'NewEucsRequirements.csv' because the text for some common controls has been updated
Head of file:
$ head ./OldEucsRequirements.csv
controlId,description
OPS-05.3H,"The CSP shall automatically monitor the systems covered by the malware protection and the configuration of the corresponding mechanisms to guarantee fulfilment of above requirements, and the antimalware scans to track detected malware or irregularities."
OPS-07.2H,"In order to check the proper application of these measures, the CSP shall automatically monitor the execution of data backups, and make available to the CSCs a service portal for monitoring the execution of backups when the CSC uses backup services with the CSP."
OPS-13.1H,"The CSP shall store all log data in an integrity-protected and aggregated form that allow its centralized evaluation, and shall automatically monitor the aggregation and deletion of logging and monitoring data."
OPS-18.6H,"The CSP shall provide and promote, where appropriate, automatic update mechanisms for the assets provided by the CSP that the CSCs have to install or operate under their own responsibility, to ease the rollout of patches and updates after an initial approval from the CSC."
OPS-09.2H,"When the backup data is transmitted to a remote location via a network, the transmission of the data takes place in an encrypted form that corresponds to the state-of-the-art (cf. CKM-02), and shall be automatically monitored by the CSP to verify the execution of the backup."
OPS-21.1H,"The CSP shall harden all the system components under its responsibility that are used to provide the cloud service, according to accepted industry standards, and automatically monitor these system components for conformity with hardening requirements."
OPS-06.1S,"The CSP shall define and implement policies and procedures according to ISP-02 for data backup and recovery, covering at least the following aspects:
(1)The extent and frequency of data backups and the duration of data retention are consistent with the contractual agreements with the CSCs and the CSP’s operational continuity requirements for recovery time objective (RTO) and recovery point objective (RPO);
(2) How data is backed up in encrypted, state-of-the-art form;
